message: Hello, people, i'm totally newbish in python and django (i've been exclusively rubist for quite a long now). There are tons of pluggable apps around, do you guys know which could be useful in doing SaaS related stuff (billing, subdomains and etc..)
There's also django-tastypie and django-piston (see the discussion https://convore.com/django-community/rest-in-django-piston-or-tastypie/ )

Given that I just built such a system (not FOSS I'm afraid) I can say the apps we used were:
django-json-rpc (since almost entirely rewritten, but a good starting place)
django-oauth
celery (most billing and subscription stuff done in tasks)
and not really a Django app, but we use Redis for a lot
and about providing some sort of multidomains and account management, such as 37signals projects
is there something at django world that could help?
is there some sort of open source project dealing with this stuff?

@pellegrino - hey, it's been a long time! you might want to check out http://github.com/johnboxall/django-paypal for integration with PayPal or http://docs.recurly.com/client-libraries/python-client for integration with Recurly. I think there's one for Chargify as well.
@pellegrino - would love to come back to Brazil and enjoy some #horaextra beers! maybe for the next PyConBrasil :)
it really depends on what you're specifically looking to do, that being said when you are looking for a solution for a particular problem http://djangopackages.com/ has some pretty good info
Thank you all guys, i'm going to look each one of the projects you pointed me out
@gg  @joshbohde  @natea thank you all for those great tips! I'll dig at each one of these :)
